questions.question_text: What does an Amazon SQS delay queue accomplish?

choices.B: Messages are hidden for a configurable amount of time after they are consumed from the queue.
choices.D: Messages cannot be deleted for a configurable amount of time after they are consumed from the queue.
choices.A: Messages are hidden for a configurable amount of time when they are first added to the queue.
choices.C: The consumer can poll the queue for a configurable amount of time before retrieving a message.

discussion.content: It's A

Selected Answer: A
The delay is the amount of time requested before the message appear to the Queue for the first time. A is correct

Selected Answer: A
It is A

Selected Answer: A
Easy A

Selected Answer: A
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSSimpleQueueService/latest/SQSDeveloperGuide/sqs-delay-queues.html

Selected Answer: A

questions.question_text:
A company stores the photographs in an Amazon S3 bucket. The company wants to resize the photographs automatically after writing the photographs to the S3 bucket. The company creates an AWS Lambda function to resize the photographs.

Which solution will meet these requirements?

discussion.content:
A. - S3 Event Notifications allow you to configure notifications for specific events that occur in your S3 bucket, such as object creation, deletion, or restoration.
 - By configuring S3 Event Notifications to invoke a Lambda function, you can trigger the Lambda function whenever the specified event occurs in the S3 bucket.
 - This option is suitable for scenarios where you want real-time processing or immediate response to events happening in your S3 bucket.
A is correct

Selected Answer: A
A is correct because S3 gives us the possibility to call a lambda function after a specif event, without call CloudWatch

Selected Answer: A
It is A

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Selected Answer: A
I will go with A

https://docs.aws.amazon.com/lambda/latest/dg/with-s3.html
You can use Lambda to process event notifications from Amazon Simple Storage Service. Amazon S3 can send an event to a Lambda function when an object is created or deleted. You configure notification settings on a bucket, and grant Amazon S3 permission to invoke a function on the function's resource-based permissions policy.

Selected Answer: A
Defo A

Selected Answer: A
Choosing A based on events

Selected Answer: A
I will go with A based on event

choices.B: Configure an S3 Lifecycle rule to invoke the Lambda function.
choices.A: Configure S3 Event Notifications to invoke the Lambda function
choices.C: Configure S3 Select on a schedule to invoke the Lambda function.
choices.D: Configure S3 Storage Lens to invoke the Lambda function.

choices.B: Add a custom S3 bucket policy to the Lambda function.
choices.D: Add the S3ReadPolicy template to the Lambda function's execution role.
choices.C: Create an Amazon Simple Queue Service (SQS) topic for only S3 object reads Reference the topic in the template.
choices.A: Reference a second Lambda authorizer function.

questions.question_text:
A developer is automating a new application deployment with AWS Serverless Application Model (AWS SAM). The new application has one AWS Lambda function and one Amazon S3 bucket. The Lambda function must access the S3 bucket to only read objects.

How should the developer configure AWS SAM to grant the necessary read privilege to the S3 bucket?

discussion.content:
D. - This option involves attaching a predefined IAM policy template (S3ReadPolicy) to the IAM role associated with the Lambda function's execution environment.
 - IAM policies define permissions for actions within AWS services. The S3ReadPolicy template, as its name suggests, likely grants permissions related to reading objects from S3 buckets.
 - By adding this template to the Lambda function's execution role, you are granting the Lambda function the necessary permissions to read objects from S3 buckets specified in the policy.
 - This is a common practice when you want to ensure that your Lambda function has the appropriate permissions to interact with S3 without manually defining the permissions in detail.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct because lambda needs to read files from S3 so we can use the S3ReadPolicy template

D. Add the S3ReadPolicy template to the Lambda function's execution role.

In AWS SAM, the permissions for an AWS Lambda function can be managed through its execution role. To grant the necessary read privilege to the S3 bucket, the developer should add the S3ReadPolicy template to the Lambda function's execution role.

The S3ReadPolicy template is an AWS managed policy that grants read-only access to an S3 bucket. It includes permissions to list the objects in the bucket and to read the objects themselves. By adding this policy to the Lambda function's execution role, the function will have the necessary permissions to access the S3 bucket to only read objects.

Selected Answer: D
Agreed D

Selected Answer: D
Lambda execution role is the answer

Selected Answer: D
Agreed

questions.question_text:
A company hosts a web application that writes to an Amazon DynamoDB table. Application users frequently observe and report errors. The development team examines Amazon CloudWatch logs and frequently sees the following error:

400 Bad Request ProvisionedThroughputExceededException

What is the cause of this error?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
It is written that the application "writes" on DynamoDB so the most likely scenario is that WCU are not collocated correctly or indexex defines hot partitions in the table. It is better to re-design the table. D is the correct answer
D it is

Selected Answer: D
D seems correct 
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/amazondynamodb/latest/developerguide/Programming.Errors.html

Selected Answer: D
I agree

choices.A: The application does not have the required permissions for the DynamoDB table.
choices.C: The development team has not allocated enough space for the table and its indexes.
choices.D: The development team has not allocated enough write capacity units (WCU) for the table and Its indexes.
choices.B: The item that the application is placing on the table exceeds the item size limit.

choices.C: Use Lambda environment variables. Update the environment variables when new credentials are available.
choices.B: Include the database credentials as part of the Lambda function code. Update the credentials periodically and deploy the new Lambda function.
choices.A: Store the database credentials in AWS Secrets Manager. Turn on rotation. Write code in the Lambda function to retrieve the credentials from Secrets Manager.
choices.D: Store the database credentials in AWS Systems Manager Parameter Store Turn on rotation. Write code in the Lambda function to retrieve the credentials from Systems Manager Parameter Store.

questions.question_text:
A company's developer is building a static website to be deployed in Amazon S3 for a production environment. The website integrates with an Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL database by using an AWS Lambda function. The website that is deployed to production will use a Lambda alias that points to a specific version of the Lambda function.

The company must rotate the database credentials every 2 weeks. Lambda functions that the company deployed previously must be able to use the most recent credentials.

Which solution will meet these requirements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Parameter Store doesn't provide automatic rotation

comments.content: Exactly what I am looking for. Thanks

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct because AWS Secretes manager supports rotation, give us a secure method to store and retrive creadential and also we can retrieve the credential in the lambda function in a secure way without change the code. A is for sure the correct answer.

Selected Answer: A
Option D suggests storing the database credentials in AWS Systems Manager Parameter Store and turning on rotation. However, AWS Systems Manager Parameter Store does not have a built-in rotation feature for database credentials. Instead, AWS Secrets Manager provides a built-in rotation feature for database credentials and can be used to automatically rotate the credentials every 2 weeks as required by the company. This is why option A is the correct answer and option D is not.

Selected Answer: A
Rotate credentials => secrets manager

Selected Answer: A
Here is a tip for the exam: 
Whenever you see "rotate the credentials" --> Secrets Manager

Selected Answer: A
AWS secret manger provides the rotation

https://docs.aws.amazon.com/systems-manager/latest/userguide/systems-manager-parameter-store.html
To implement password rotation lifecycles, use AWS Secrets Manager. You can rotate, manage, and retrieve database credentials, API keys, and other secrets throughout their lifecycle using Secrets Manager. For more information, see What is AWS Secrets Manager? in the AWS Secrets Manager User Guide.

Selected Answer: A
Ans is A

Selected Answer: A
As explained by Michal David.

Selected Answer: A
Choosing A

A
To implement password rotation lifecycles, use AWS Secrets Manager. You can rotate, manage, and retrieve database credentials, API keys, and other secrets throughout their lifecycle using Secrets Manager
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/secretsmanager/latest/userguide/intro.html
